page.title: 01TELEPHONES AMBERLEY RACKHAM
page.content: Most houses have a telephone. There is one public telephone not in the area at Rackham., Isolated houses rely on the telephone for contact with other people the farm houses in this area have only one or two cottages near them. Kithurst Farm is at the end of a two mile lane. There are four letter boxes in this area, but post is delivered twice a day by postmen in vans from Arundel. There are two collections a day from the letter boxes. The postmen will sometimes take your letter and post it if you are a long way from a letter box. Newspapers are not delivered, but many isolated communities arrange that one person collects the newspaper and either delivers them or they are collected by individuals from one central point.
